article.headline: P&G's stock climbs toward a record after profit and sales beats, upbeat outlook
article.body: Shares of Procter & Gamble Co. PG, +0.89% climbed 2.6% toward a record high in premarket trading Thursday, after the consumer products company reported fiscal fourth-quarter profit and revenue that beat expectations and provided an upbeat outlook, amid increased demand for household cleaning and personal health products amid the COVID-19 pandemic. P&G swung to net income of $2.80 billion, or $1.07 a share, from a loss of $5.24 billion, or $2.12 a share, in the year-ago period, which included an impairment charge for the Gillette Share Care business. Excluding non-recurring items, core earnings per share came to $1.16, above the FactSet consensus of $1.01. Sales rose 4% to $17.70 billion, above the FactSet consensus of $16.95 billion, as volumes grew 3% and prices rose 2%. For fiscal 2021, P&G expects core EPS growth of 3% to 7% from 2020 core EPS of $5.12, while the current FactSet EPS consensus of $5.23 implies 2.1% growth. The stock, which closed the previous session at a record $128.31, has advanced 2.7% year to date through Wednesday, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% has slipped 7.0%.
